question: 紫蘇
sourceMnemonic:
What could a <kanji>purple</kanji> <kanji>revive</kanji> be? This actually means <vocabulary>shiso</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>Japanese Perilla</vocabulary>, and it's a type of herb commonly used in Japanese cuisine. You can remember this refers to a plant by the <radical>flowers</radical> radical in 蘇. You might also want to google "shiso," as you'll notice how some of them have purple leaves!

Note that, as with other plant and tree species, you'll often encounter this being written in katakana as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
